content.description: Using a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value of <math alttext="0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.05</mtext></math>, researchers performed a chi-square analysis of the distribution of phenotypes in the <math alttext="F 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>F</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> generation.
content.question: Which of the following chi-square calculated values would cause the researchers to reject their null hypothesis?
